subject: RE: [junit] JavaCC question
msgSnippet: I m on a really crappy connection so I can t download anything right now. I think there is one pretty decent example in the example directory, but if memory
messageBody:
I'm on a really crappy connection so I can't download anything right now.
I think there is one pretty decent example in the example directory, but
if memory serves me correctly it is in an unobvious place.

JRefactory uses JavaCC so you may want to look at the jjt in there (it's
a good one).

Lots of folks talk good about ATNLR, too, and I think it has pretty
decent support from mailing lists and such.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Vladimir Bossicard [mailto:vladimir@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 26, 2001 5:51 PM
> To: emeade@...
> Cc: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JavaCC question
>
>
> Hi Erik,
>
> question not related to JUnit but JavaCC (I saw that you were
> enthusiastic about that product). I try to write a code
> generator for JUnit testcases and plan to use JavaCC to parse the
> java files. I have successfully generated the parser for the
> Java language.
>
> My question is: how can I traverse the JJTree? I haven't found
> yet a real great example to use the Visitor interface and don't
> want to spend too much time on searching.
>
> Do you have had experiences with JavaCC and the Visitor
> interface? If so, I would be extremely glad to hear from you.
>
> -Vladimir
>
>
>
